reviewText: Great way to learn the hula if you live out in the middle of nowhere!  I had been dancing hula as a young woman, but wanted to start up again for exercise.  The videos are clear and thorough, and fun!

My wife enjoys this video. Instructions are very detailed, all movements are demonstrated clearly. Booklet has words with translation, description of all movements and ipu pattern.
Very high quality teaching video.

aloha mai kakou, warm greetings to us all
I purchased this dvd back in 2007.  I began studying hula and the first hula we learned was "Kawika".  The style of our halau/school was different than this style but it was a great resource.  Kumu Pattye is a revered teacher on O'ahu and one of my kumus has studied with her.
The dvd goes step by step, line by line, with the olapa/dancer in front of a mirror.  So you know exactly what to do, if you follow and know hula form.  Please don't purchase this dvd and think you are a hula dancer.  I have seen some people on youtube who may have thought "oh I'll buy this, learn the steps and perform in public".  Hula is not about dancing, it's about the perpetuation of the Hawaiian culture.  It is about language, it is about protocol, it is about history and most importantly it is about honour.  Build a relationship with a respected kumu/teacher in person and use this dvd as a practice tool.
aloha...k

I am sorry to say that I found the price quite steep for what it had to offer.  Compared to Patricia Lei Anderson Murray's videos and DVDs which are cheaper and  have much more to offer, I found this one sorely lacking.  It whet my appetite and it was over.
Those interested in Hawaiian culture and tradition will find this a fun DVD to practice beginner hula with this "foundation" number.  It has also tweaked my interest in the ipu.
It was very good for step by step instruction.  I enjoyed very much and gladly recommend for the beginner. I am very satisfied.
